internal: How can I help you today?

Docker Stats is a command used to display the resource usage of containers, such as CPU, memory, and network IO statistics. To view this information, simply run the following command in your terminal: `docker stats [container_name or container_id]`. This will provide you with real-time metrics about the selected container's resources utilization.
is there a way to see more details of CPU utilisation?

Yes, to get detailed information on CPU usage for a specific container, run the command `docker stats --cpu [container_name or container_id]`. This will display both the total and percentage usage of CPU resources by the container. You can also use the option `--no-stream` to view historical data since Docker starts the container.
